name: Sandie's Seven-Layer Bean Dip
author: Kenys "B"
summary: At every family gathering, I am asked to make this dish. It's so yummy, it's always the first thing to go. Serve dip with chips or spread onto tortillas. It's great when topped with guacamole!
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix sour cream, cream cheese, and   mix together in a bowl
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir beef with the cumin, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease
Spread refried beans into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish
Layer ground beef mixture over refried beans, lightly pressing beef into beans; top with sour cream mixture
Stir salsa and salsa con queso together in a bowl; pour over sour cream mixture layer
Spread Mexican cheese blend, tomato, olives, and green onions, respectively, over sour cream mixture layer
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and bubbling, about 30 minutes
